column4: I think I might just clean a HDD and do a dual boot... I gather Win cannot read extfs and linux cannot read NTFS, so would it be smart to create a FAT partition on a drive in case I need to swap data between OSes?
actually linux can read ntfs and windows can read extX
You need to download drivers for windows but I think it's out of the box for linux
In any event linux can read NTFS it just can't run nativly on it yet.  Unless you count wubi
